values.title: Shannon L Alder
values.desc: If you spend your time hoping someone will suffer the consequences for what they did to your heart then youre allowing them to hurt you a second time in your mind

values.title: Stephanie Klein Straight Up and Dirty
values.desc: What we wait around a lifetime for with one person we can find in a moment with someone else

values.title: Shannon L Alder
values.desc: Every woman that finally figured out her worth has picked up her suitcases of pride and boarded a flight to freedom which landed in the valley of change

values.title: Jonathan Franzen
values.desc: Nice people dont necessarily fall in love with nice people

values.title: Kate Chisman
values.desc: We ruined each other by being together We destroyed each others dreams

values.title: Jennifer Weiner
values.desc: Divorce isnt such a tragedy A tragedys staying in an unhappy marriage teaching your children the wrong things about love Nobody ever died of divorce

values.title: Suzanne Finnamore
values.desc: Such silence has an actual sound the sound of disappearance

values.title: Michael Bassey Johnson
values.desc: It is better to lock up your heart with a merciless padlock than to fall in love with someone who doesnt know what they mean to you

values.title: Taylor Jenkins Reid
values.desc: Heartbreak is a loss Divorce is a piece of paper

values.title: Joyce Brothers
values.desc: My husband and I have never considered divorce murder sometimes but never divorce

values.title: Gillian Flynn
values.desc: My dad had limitations Thats what my goodhearted mom always told us He had limitations but he meant no harm It was kind of her to say but he did do harm

values.title: Groucho Marx
values.desc: Hollywood brides keep the bouquets and throw away the grooms

values.title: Suzanne Finnamore
values.desc: I used to loathe ambivalence now I adore it Ambivalence is my new best friend

values.title: Suzanne Finnamore
values.desc: Delusion detests focus and romance provides the veil

values.title: Joe Hill
values.desc: Taking a thing apart is always faster than putting something together This is true of everything except marriage
